title: Vastu for the Living Room: How to Invite Positive Energy (D’MURO Guide)
description:
Simple, practical Vastu tips for living rooms—best directions, furniture placement, colors, lighting, plants, and décor to invite positive energy. Vastu living room guide by D’MURO (Noida).
 
The living room is the heart of a home—where family gathers, guests arrive, and daily life unfolds. In Vastu Shastra, the layout and arrangement of this space can influence harmony, energy, and well-being. Below is a practical, easy-to-follow guide to Vastu for the living room that blends traditional principles with modern interiors (perfect for Indian homes and urban apartments).

Best directions for the living room (quick overview)
Most auspicious: Northeast (NE)—ideal for a spiritual corner or prayer nook.

Excellent for energy & prosperity: North and East — bright, airy and good for social spaces.

Recommended placement for sofa backs: South or West walls (so people sit facing North or East).

Avoid placing the main living area in: Southwest (can cause heaviness) and Southeast (careful with fire/electrical zones).

Practical note: in many apartments you can’t change the layout — but positioning furniture, lighting and décor thoughtfully can still improve the energy flow.

Layout & furniture: straightforward Vastu rules that work

Sofa placement: Place larger sofas against the south or west wall so people face north or east when seated. This encourages positive conversation and better flow.

Seating arrangement: Keep pathways clear. Avoid blocking doors or windows with large furniture.

Center table & shapes: Wooden coffee tables are preferred. Avoid sharp corners—rounded edges help maintain calm.

Doors & windows: Ideally, the main entry to the living room should be toward the north or east; windows on the east or north let in healthy daylight and ventilation.

Colors & lighting for positive vibes

Best color palette: soft, light tones — white, light yellow, green, beige. These hues create calm and openness.

Colors to avoid: heavy use of black, dark grey or dark red; these can feel oppressive if used extensively.

Lighting: daylight is best. For evenings, use warm LED or yellow-toned lighting and layer ambient + task lighting (ceiling, table lamps, accent). Avoid harsh blue-white lights for the main living area.

Electronics & décor—smart Vastu placement

TV & electronics: Place the TV in the southeast zone if possible. Avoid placing a TV in the northeast. Keep electronic clutter minimal—too many gadgets can disturb the space’s calm.

Wall clocks: North or east walls are most suitable.

Family photos: A family photo or portrait looks best on the southwest wall to symbolically anchor relationships.

Water features or images of water: Position toward the northeast for positive energy.

Avoid: aggressive or sad imagery (war scenes, violent art)—choose uplifting, peaceful artwork instead.

Plants & spiritual elements that invite harmony

Top plants for the living room: money plant, tulsi (holy basil), Areca palm, and lucky bamboo. These are commonly used for freshness and good vibes.

Where to place plants: North, northeast or east corners are usually good. Avoid placing large plants in the center of the living room.

Puja / spiritual corner: A small, tidy spiritual nook in the northeast with a simple idol or picture, fresh flowers and soft lighting helps create a serene focal point.

Accessories: wind chimes (soft tones), clay diyas or candles — all add warm, positive ambience.


Keep it light and clutter-free

A tidy living room improves energy flow. Remove broken, unused items and keep the centre of the room visually open.

Avoid heavy, dark furniture concentrated in one area; balance weight across the room.

Use natural scents (incense or essential oils) moderately to refresh the space.


Vastu Do’s & Don’ts—Quick Checklist

Do:

Use light, warm colours and layered lighting.
Place sofas against south/west walls, facing north/east.
Keep the northeast for spiritual corner or water features.
Add plants (money plant, bamboo, Tulsi) for positive vibes.

Don’t:

1) Avoid heavy dark colours across large surfaces.
2) Don’t place mirrors on the south or west walls.
3) Limit multiple electronic appliances in the living area.
4) Avoid artwork that shows violence, sadness, or discord.


FAQs 

Q: Which direction should my living room face according to Vastu?
 A: Northeast is most auspicious for spiritual energy, while north and east are preferred for living/social spaces. If you can’t change orientation, focus on furniture placement and light.

Q: What colors are best for a Vastu-compliant living room?
 A: Soft, calming tones—white, light yellow, green, and beige—work well. Avoid heavy blacks and dark reds for main surfaces.
Q: Where should I place the TV as per Vastu?
 A: Ideally, in the southeast zone. Avoid placing the TV in the northeast sector.
Q: Can I keep plants in the living room? Which ones?
 A: Yes—money plant, Tulsi, areca palm, and bamboo are commonly recommended.
Q: Are mirrors allowed in the living room?
 A: Mirrors are fine, but avoid placing them on the south or west walls. North or east walls are better choices.





Final note—Vastu, with modern design!!

Vastu offers simple principles that can be adapted to modern homes without sacrificing aesthetics. Small changes—the direction you face while sitting, the color palette, where you place your television or spiritual corner, and keeping clutter low—can make your living room feel lighter, calmer and more welcoming.
If you’re in Noida or the Delhi-NCR area and want a living room that blends a Vastu-friendly layout with modern luxury, D’MURO can help. We design interiors that feel beautiful and balanced.
Ready to invite positive energy into your home?
 📩 Book a Vastu-aware design consultation with D’MURO → [dmuro.com] or DM us on Instagram [@dmuro_design].

title: Interior Design Trends to Watch in 2025: A Style Forecast by D’MURO
description:
Introduction

Interior design in 2025 goes beyond aesthetics—it reflects the way we live, work, and connect with our spaces. As homes continue to evolve into sanctuaries of comfort, creativity, and functionality, design trends mirror these changing lifestyles. At D’MURO, we believe interiors should not only look beautiful but also feel meaningful, sustainable, and timeless.
Our team has carefully observed the shifts in materials, colors, textures, and design philosophies that will define the year ahead. Here’s a look at the top interior design trends for 2025 that are set to inspire homes with elegance, innovation, and personality.

1. Sustainable & Eco-Friendly Designs

Sustainability is no longer an option—it’s a necessity. 2025 sees homeowners embracing reclaimed wood, eco-friendly textiles, recycled materials, and low-VOC finishes. Interiors are being designed with an eye on reducing environmental impact while maintaining luxury and style. At D’MURO, we see this as a shift toward conscious living, where every material tells a story of responsibility and refined taste.

2. Earthy Tones & Nature-Inspired Palettes

Warm, grounding shades such as terracotta, olive green, clay, and sandy beige are dominating modern interiors. These palettes, drawn from nature, create serene spaces that bring calm and balance to contemporary homes. Whether through wall treatments, upholstery, or subtle accents, earthy tones in 2025 are redefining modern luxury with simplicity and elegance.

3. Multifunctional & Adaptive Spaces

With homes becoming more fluid, multifunctional spaces are a strong trend. Adaptive furniture, flexible layouts, and designs that serve multiple purposes are gaining importance. From modular kitchens that double as social hubs to wardrobes that maximize storage while showcasing design, 2025 celebrates spaces that are as functional as they are stylish.

4. Statement Lighting Fixtures

Lighting is stepping into the spotlight—literally. Oversized pendants, sculptural chandeliers, and bold fixtures are no longer just functional but serve as central design elements. Textures like brushed metals, blown glass, and rattan add depth and artistry. This year, lighting defines ambiance and personality, transforming rooms into curated experiences.

5. Smart & Tech-Integrated Interiors

Technology continues to blend seamlessly with interiors. From voice-controlled lighting and automated climate control to integrated smart appliances, homes in 2025 are designed to be intuitive and responsive. At D’MURO, we view smart interiors as the perfect harmony of modern innovation and timeless design aesthetics—where technology enhances comfort without compromising beauty.

6. Bold Textures & Mixed Patterns

Rich textures and daring pattern combinations are taking center stage. Velvet, boucle, jute, and natural weaves combine with bold geometric, floral, and striped patterns to create layers of depth. This playful mix adds energy, personality, and sophistication, breaking away from minimalism into a more expressive design language.

7. Wellness-Centric Design

Homes are increasingly being designed as wellness retreats. Natural light, clutter-free layouts, soft neutral palettes, and biophilic elements like indoor plants create spaces that promote mindfulness and relaxation. In 2025, wellness-driven interiors go beyond aesthetics—they embody a lifestyle that values peace, balance, and emotional well-being.

8. Artisanal Craft & Custom-Made Pieces

Personalization and authenticity are in demand. Handcrafted furniture, artisanal ceramics, bespoke wall treatments, and locally sourced décor elements are adding soul to modern interiors. Homeowners are moving away from mass production, embracing pieces that carry heritage, craftsmanship, and individuality. For D’MURO, this reflects our philosophy—designs that are timeless, meaningful, and truly one of a kind.

Conclusion

The interior design trends of 2025 embrace sustainability, wellness, personalization, and bold creativity. From earthy palettes and artisanal crafts to smart technologies and multifunctional spaces, the year is all about homes that are not just stylish but deeply connected to the way we live.
At D’MURO, we don’t just follow trends—we create interiors that transform spaces into experiences. As 2025 unfolds, our vision remains clear: to design homes that are functional, sustainable, and beautifully reflective of your lifestyle.

title: Kitchen Makeover: From Outdated to Modern Luxury
description:
A kitchen is often called the heart of a home, yet many kitchens lose their charm over the years. Outdated layouts, dull finishes, and poor lighting make them feel uninspiring and difficult to work in. This before-and-after transformation demonstrates how thoughtful design can breathe new life into a space, turning a cluttered, old-fashioned kitchen into a modern luxury haven.

On the left side of the split view, the “Before” kitchen reflects an all-too-familiar look—dark brown cabinets that make the space feel heavy and closed, countertops filled with clutter, and dim lighting that fails to highlight the area. The design feels dated, with functionality compromised by bulky cabinetry and a lack of smart storage. Cooking here may feel more like a chore than an enjoyable daily activity. This kind of outdated setup not only affects aesthetics but also reduces efficiency in one of the most important spaces in any home.

The "After" transformation on the right side tells a completely different story. The kitchen has been reimagined into a luxury modular design that is sleek, functional, and visually striking. Glossy cabinets in contemporary finishes immediately uplift the mood, reflecting light to make the space look larger and brighter. Marble countertops bring elegance and sophistication, offering both beauty and durability. Instead of clutter, the surfaces are clean and minimal, with storage solutions hidden behind seamless cabinet doors.

Lighting plays a transformative role as well. LED strip lights under the cabinets, combined with soft overhead fixtures, create a layered illumination that highlights every corner. The dull atmosphere of the old design is replaced by a bright, vibrant setting that feels welcoming and practical. Modern appliances are integrated into the layout, making cooking, cleaning, and storage effortless while enhancing the overall aesthetic.

The transformation captures more than just visual appeal—it showcases a shift in lifestyle. The “After” kitchen is designed for both function and enjoyment: a space where cooking becomes an experience, family gatherings feel natural, and hosting guests becomes a pleasure.

This side-by-side comparison illustrates how a well-planned interior upgrade can completely redefine the personality of a home. From a cramped, outdated room to a modern culinary hub, this makeover is proof that the kitchen can truly be the centerpiece of luxury living.
